1.brief: David, the youngest son of Jesse
properly, to toss, i.e. grapple; mostly figuratively, to wrangle, i.e. hold a controversy; (by implication) to defend
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
literally he will contend; properly, adjective, contentious; used as noun, an adversary
to feed on; figuratively, to consume; by implication, to battle (as destruction)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
to feed on; figuratively, to consume; by implication, to battle (as destruction)

2.brief: to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer
a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile
a hook (as pointed); also a (large) shield (as if guarding by prickliness); also cold (as piercing)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)

3.brief: to pour out (literally or figuratively), i.e. empty
a lance (for thrusting, like pitching a tent)
to shut up; figuratively, to surrender
an encountering, accidental, friendly or hostile (also adverbially, opposite)
to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity

4.brief: properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
properly, to wound; but only figuratively, to taunt or insult
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, to flinch, i.e. (by implication) to go back, literally (to retreat) or figuratively (to apostatize)
the hinder part; hence (adverb) behind, backward; also (as facing north) the West
to blush; figuratively, to be ashamed, disappointed; causatively, to shame, reproach

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

5.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
chaff (as pressed out, i.e. winnowed or (rather) threshed loose)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

6.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
properly, something very smooth; i.e. a treacherous spot; figuratively, blandishment
a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)

7.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
gratis, i.e. devoid of cost, reason or advantage
a pit (especially as a trap); figuratively, destruction
gratis, i.e. devoid of cost, reason or advantage
properly, to pry into; by implication, to delve, to explore
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

8.brief: to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to catch (in a net, trap or pit); generally, to capture or occupy; also to choose (by lot); figuratively, to cohere
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)

9.brief: properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity

10.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
strong (usu. in a bad sense, hard, bold, violent)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to pluck off; specifically to flay, strip or rob

11.brief: to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
concretely, a witness; abstractly, testimony; specifically, a recorder, i.e. prince
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand

12.brief: to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

13.brief: properly, to be rubbed or worn; hence (figuratively) to be weak, sick, afflicted; or (causatively) to grieve, make sick; also to stroke (in flattering), entreat
a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife
properly, a mesh (as allowing a liquid to run through), i.e. coarse loose cloth or sacking (used in mourning and for bagging); hence, a bag (for grain, etc.)
to depress literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive (in various applications, as follows)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

14.brief: a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
a mother (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively (like father))
to be ashy, i.e. darkcolored; by implication, to mourn (in sackcloth or sordid garments)
to sink or depress (reflexive or causative)

15.brief: probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to rend, literally or figuratively (revile, paint the eyes, as if enlarging them)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be dumb; by implication, to be astonished, to stop; also to perish

16.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff

17.brief: the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
a village (as covered in by walls); also a young lion (perhaps as covered with a mane)
properly, united, i.e. sole; by implication, beloved; also lonely; (feminine) the life (as not to be replaced)

18.brief: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
powerful (specifically, a paw); by implication, numerous
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify

19.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)
gratis, i.e. devoid of cost, reason or advantage
to pinch, i.e. (partially) to bite the lips, blink the eyes (as a gesture of malice), or (fully) to squeeze off (a piece of clay in order to mould a vessel from it)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing

the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing

properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

23.brief: properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)

the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy

to blush; figuratively, to be ashamed, disappointed; causatively, to shame, reproach
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace

to murmur (in pleasure or anger); by implication, to ponder
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
